intro: Ceropegia borii, commonly known as the mountain ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Ceropegia borii is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
